content.question: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of the fraction with numerator 6 times e raised to the 4 x power, minus 2 times e raised to the 3 x power, minus 4, and denominator the sine of 2 x, end fraction, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
